Good Morning: This is a daily review of the stocks in your portfolio, updated on `r date_time`. The data is lagged by ~1 day.

---
```{r echo=FALSE, message=FALSE, warning=FALSE}

symbols <- c("VDE",
             "VOO",
             "QQQM",
             "QQQ",
             "VYM",
             "COST",
             "AAPL",
             "GOOGL",
             "AMZN",
             "JPM",
             "MSFT",
             "NVDA",
             "BYDDY",
             "BABA",
             "V"
             )

# gather list of stocks 
stock_df <- map(symbols, ~getSymbols(.x, src='yahoo', from="2010-01-02", auto.assign=FALSE))
names(stock_df) <- symbols

# stack data
main_df <- map_df(
  symbols,
  ~clean_data(.x, data = stock_df)
) 

constructs <-  main_df %>% 
  group_by(stock) %>% 
  mutate(
    # SMA
    sma_50  = TTR::SMA(Close, n = 50),
    sma_100 = TTR::SMA(Close, n = 100),
    
    # EMA
    ema_63  = TTR::EMA(Close, n = 63),
    
    pct_mavg = (sma_50/lag(sma_50, n = 50) - 1) * 100,
    pct_emavg = (ema_63/lag(ema_63, n = 63) - 1) * 100,
    
    diff_prev  = Close- lag(Close) ,
    DayOverDay  = (diff_prev/abs(lag(Close))),
    diff_week  = Close- lag(Close, 7) ,
    WeekOverWeek  = (diff_prev/abs(lag(Close, 7))),
    diff_month = Close- lag(Close, 30) ,
    MonthOverMonth = (diff_prev/abs(lag(Close, 30)))
    
  ) %>% ungroup()



split_df <- split(constructs, constructs$stock)
list_infl <- map(symbols, ~get_inflections(.x, df = split_df))
names(list_infl) <- symbols

```

### Summary Table
```{r echo=FALSE, message=FALSE, warning=FALSE}
constructs %>% 
  slice_max(date) %>% 
  select(stock, High, Low, Close, DayOverDay, WeekOverWeek, MonthOverMonth) %>% 
  DT::datatable(
    options = list(pageLength = 30, autoWidth = TRUE)
  ) %>% 
  DT::formatStyle(
    c("DayOverDay", "WeekOverWeek", "MonthOverMonth"),
    backgroundColor = DT::styleInterval(0, c('pink', 'lightgreen'))
    ) %>% 
  DT::formatPercentage(c("DayOverDay", "WeekOverWeek", "MonthOverMonth"),1) %>% 
  DT::formatRound(c("High", "Low", "Close"), 2)
```
